casebody.data:
CARILLON
v.
NCDHHS, et al. No. 54A06. Supreme Court of North Carolina. October 4, 2006. Melissa L. Trippe, Mark A. Davis, Special Deputy Attorney Generals, Thomas M. Woodward, Susan K. Hackney, Assistant Attorney Generals, Christopher G. Browning, Solicitor-General, for NCDHHS et al. Forrest W. Campbell, Jr., Greensboro, Charles F. Marshall, III, Raleigh, for Carillon Assistant Living.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 28th day of September 2006 by Petitioner for Extension of Time to File Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Petitioner (Carillon Assistant Living) shall have up to and including the 16th day of October 2006 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court. By order of the Court in conference this the 4th day of October 2006."
